items.title: Davey Wreden's New Game 'Wanderstop' Explores Emotional Depths Through Tea-Making
items.author: Lewis Gordon
items.summary:
- Davey Wreden, known for unconventional games, releases a new title, [Wanderstop](https://youtu.be/TrAJzniyyZI).
- The game features a protagonist named Alta, a fighter in a tea-making fantasy setting, focusing on emotional recovery.
- Wreden seeks to create a game about 'existing in the moment' after experiencing burnout from his previous works.
- Wanderstop combines narrative adventure with cozy farming simulator elements.
- Wreden's trajectory reflects a shift from attention-seeking games to more sincere storytelling.
- The game examines themes of personal demons, mental health, and the limitations of self-care.

items.title: OpenAI launches new tools to help developers build AI agents
Media Matters sues X to stop lawsuits outside of the US
Tesla Cybertruck: all the news about Elon Musk’s futuristic pickup truck
Anker’s compact travel charger works in over 200 countries
A new Pixel 10 leak shows Google adding another camera
BlizzCon is returning in 2026 after a few years off
items.author: Jay Peters
items.summary:
- BlizzCon 2026 will take place on September 12th and 13th, 2026, at the Anaheim Convention Center.
- Blizzard has not revealed specific games to be featured but promises an elevated experience with traditional elements like the Opening Ceremony and hands-on gameplay.
- The last BlizzCon occurred in 2023, showcasing new content for Diablo IV and World of Warcraft, among others.

items.title: How longer-lasting, faster-charging batteries are coming via software updates
Google held back Pixel 4A batteries to avoid overheating risk
Monopolies, scalpers, and the future of online ticket sales
items.author: Lauren Feiner
items.summary:
- Ticketmaster faces continued scrutiny and potential antitrust action after a ticketing crisis during Taylor Swift's Eras Tour in 2022.
- Live Nation, which operates Ticketmaster, is accused of monopolistic practices, sparking investigations by the DOJ.
- Legislation is being proposed across many states to regulate ticket sales, aiming to improve consumer experiences and potentially limit Ticketmaster's power.
- The DOJ filed a lawsuit against Live Nation in May 2024, alleging it crushes competition, and criticisms of its business practices are ongoing.
- Resale ticketing remains controversial, with arguments over consumer rights and how it affects ticket prices and accessibility.
- Rival ticketing companies are spending substantially on lobbying to influence legislation that could benefit their interests against Ticketmaster.

items.title: Waymo is now offering 24/7 robotaxi rides in Silicon Valley
New Katamari Damacy game rolls onto Apple Arcade in April
items.author: Ash Parrish
items.summary:
- A new game, **Katamari Damacy Rolling Live**, will be released on **Apple Arcade** exclusively on **April 3rd**.
- The premise involves the **King of All Cosmos** becoming a livestreamer, where players use joystick controls to roll katamaris.
- Previous releases include **Katamari Damacy Reroll** (2018) and **We Love Katamari REROLL+ Royal Reverie** (2023), remasters of the series' initial games.
- Other games launching on April 3rd include **Space Invaders Infinity Gene Evolve**, which modernizes the classic **Space Invaders** gameplay.
- Additional games for April include **RollerCoaster Tycoon Classic+**, **Puffies**, **The Game of Life 2+**, and **Sesame Street Mecha Builders+**.

items.title: TikTok will play ‘calming music’ to remind teens to stop using the app
items.author: Emma Roth
items.summary:
- TikTok introduces a feature to help teens stop using the app after 10 PM, which plays calming music as a reminder.
- A second, less dismissible reminder will be displayed if the first is ignored.
- TikTok is planning future tests of meditation exercises in this feature.
- Updates to the Family Pairing feature will now include a Time Away option to restrict app access during specific times.
- TikTok implements age assurance technology to prevent children under 13 from accessing the app, partnering with Telefonica for age verification based on telecom data.
- These updates coincide with growing legislative focus on child safety online, including new laws for age verification when downloading apps.

items.title: US tariffs: how Trump’s tax is hitting Big Tech and beyond
items.author: Emma Roth
items.summary:
- President Trump imposed significant tariffs on imports from Canada, Mexico, and China, affecting various consumer goods and sectors.
- Automakers and Big Tech companies are bracing for the impact, with potential price increases expected.
- Companies like Target and Best Buy report that consumer prices may rise soon due to these tariffs.
- Trump is set to enforce a 25% tariff on imported goods from Mexico and Canada starting March 4th, with China facing a 10% increase on existing tariffs.

items.title: Self-driving cars: Google and others map the road to automated vehicles
items.author: Verge Staff
items.summary:
- Waymo's partnership with Uber is now active in Austin, Texas, allowing residents to hail fully driverless robotaxis via the Uber app.
- General Motors has halted funding for its Cruise robotaxi service, redirecting investments towards owner-operated autonomous vehicles due to financial losses.
- Concerns are rising about the safety and performance of robotic taxis, with federal investigations into Waymo's vehicles for crashes and traffic law violations.
- Public opinion is increasingly wary of self-driving cars, stemming from high-profile incidents involving robotaxis obstructing first responders and other vehicles.

items.title: The creators of the Las Vegas Sphere want to open smaller mini-Spheres
items.author: Andrew Liszewski
items.summary:
- Sphere Entertainment spent around $2.3 billion to build the Las Vegas Sphere, which originally estimated costs at $1.2 billion.
- The company is designing mini-Spheres with a capacity of about 5,000 people to make entertainment venues more affordable.
- Mini-Spheres aim to offer immersive experiences similar to the original venue, featuring giant wraparound screens with the potential to screen concert films.

items.title: AMD Ryzen 9 9950X3D review: the best CPU
items.author: Tom Warren
items.summary:
- AMD's Ryzen 9 9950X3D priced at $699 is touted as the best CPU for gaming and creator tasks.
- The 16-core Ryzen 9 9950X3D outperforms Intel's Core i9-14900K and Core Ultra 9 285K in creator workloads.
- Improved clock speeds and second-generation 3D V-Cache enhance performance for both gaming and productivity tasks.
- Testing reveals the 9950X3D is about 24% faster in productivity tests compared to the 9800X3D.
- The CPU maintains strong gaming performance, matching or exceeding the 9800X3D in various games.
- Under heavy workloads, it uses less power and runs cooler than Intel's competitive offerings.
- AMD now offers a capable processor that excels in both gaming and creator tasks, closing the gap on Intel's chips.

items.title: Apple MacBook Air M4 Review: A Little More for a Little Less
items.author: Antonio G. Di Benedetto
items.summary:
- The 13- and 15-inch MacBook Airs feature new M4 chips and a price drop of $100.
- The 13-inch model starts at $999 and the 15-inch starts at $1,199, both with 256GB storage.
- Highlighted benefits include a full day battery life, solid performance with improved webcams, and Thunderbolt 4 ports.
- Downsides are limited storage options, fewer ports, and potential throttling during heavy tasks.
- New features focus on enhanced multitasking with support for multiple external displays.
- Overall, the new models enhance user experience while maintaining affordability in the laptop market.

items.title: Apple Mac Studio (M3 Ultra) first look: a weekend with an $8,000 powerhouse
items.author: Chris Welch
items.summary:
- The M3 Ultra Mac Studio starts at $3,999, with a fully upgraded price of $14,099.
- Not designed for average consumers; primarily aimed at professionals in video, photography, and resource-heavy workloads.
- The Mac Studio is the first Mac to complete a 4K export in Premiere Pro in under a minute.
- Comparison suggests M4 Mac Mini as a better option for most users at a lower price point.
- The machine tested is priced at $8,099, featuring a 32-core CPU, 80-core GPU, 4TB storage, and 256GB unified memory.
- Offers Thunderbolt 5 connectivity with data transfer speeds theoretically up to 120Gb/s.
- Supports up to eight external displays; the M4 Max model supports five.
- Overall, delivers high performance while maintaining a quiet operation; suitable for various professional tasks, including running AI models locally.

items.title: China has some big ideas about smartphones
items.author: David Pierce
items.summary:
- The US smartphone market lacks innovation, dominated mainly by iPhones and Galaxies.
- Recent insights from Mobile World Congress 2025 showcase innovative smartphone designs like twistable and foldable models.
- New phones are being introduced with large camera lenses, AI capabilities, and built-in loudspeakers.
- The reinvention of Digg is discussed, aiming to change online social networks with AI assistance for moderators.
- A discussion regarding the disappointing state of printer technology and the public’s desire for better options.

items.title: Ford’s Tesla Supercharger adapters are now on sale for $200
items.author: Andrew J. Hawkins
items.summary:
- Ford has started selling Tesla NACS adapters for $200 after a complimentary period for 140,000 customers.
- The adapters were co-developed with Lectron and can handle up to 500 amps and 1,000 volts.
- Ford has faced issues with delays and recalls related to the adapters, even issuing a service bulletin about charging speed issues for a small batch.

items.title: All the news about EV charging in the US
items.author: Verge Staff
items.summary:
- The CCS plug is currently more widespread in North America than Tesla's standard.
- Tesla is opening up its connector as the North American Charging Standard (NACS), competing with CCS.
- Major automakers like Ford, GM, and Toyota are standardizing on NACS by 2026.
- The U.S. government is investing $7.5 billion to improve EV charging infrastructure.
- The situation for charging EVs in North America is improving, albeit slowly, with several automakers announcing new products and partnerships.

items.title: Microsoft is replacing Remote Desktop with its new Windows app
Brompton G e-bike review: truth in advertising
The best instant cameras you can buy right now
Steam Deck, ROG Ally, and more: all the news about the handheld PC gaming revolution
items.author: Verge Staff
items.summary:
- Today marks the third anniversary of Steam Deck, which has significantly impacted the handheld PC gaming market.
- Despite a rocky start, Valve’s device has outsold all its competitors combined according to IDC estimates.
- New products like the Asus ROG Ally X and Lenovo Legion Go are emerging, with various reviews highlighting their features and performance.
- The Steam Deck Folio Kickstarter campaign aims to provide a protective case that doubles as a stand.
- The ROG Ally battery upgrade kit offers an increase of 62.5% more battery life.

items.title: The best iPhones
Ex-Google CEO Eric Schmidt is the newest Big Tech-to-space exec
This is just the start
items.author: Gaby Del Valle
items.summary:
- Mahmoud Khalil, a former Columbia University student, was arrested by ICE on March 8 for involvement in pro-Palestine protests despite having a green card.
- ICE claimed they were enacting orders from the State Department to revoke his student visa; however, Khalil is a permanent resident which complicates this.
- Khalil's attorney described the arrest as retaliation against political speech, highlighting government repression of students criticizing Israel's actions in Gaza.
- The Department of Homeland Security labeled Khalil's activities as aligned with Hamas, suggesting a targeting of protests against Israel under the guise of national security.
- Concerns were raised about ICE's surveillance capabilities and the chilling effect of such arrests on free speech and activism on campus.

items.title: The best Mario Day deals on Nintendo Switch games and accessories
items.author: Sheena Vasani
items.summary: - Many retailers are offering steep discounts for Mario titles and accessories to celebrate Mario Day. - The sale includes new Nintendo Switch bundles and iconic Mario games available at their lowest prices to date. - Discounts from various retailers will continue through March 16, 2025, with many deals featured on platforms like Amazon and Walmart. - Key game titles like Super Mario Bros. Wonder and Super Mario RPG are highlighted with significant savings. - Also included in the deals are Mario-themed Legos and accessories, marking a festive shopping opportunity for fans.

items.title: Bluesky gets three-minute videos and a filter to help with DM spam
The entire story of Twitter / X under Elon Musk
Nintendo's Alarmo uses the tech that could solve Joy-Con stick drift
items.author: Andrew Liszewski
items.summary:
- Nintendo continues to use older Joy-Con hardware potentially causing joystick drift issues.
- iFixit reveals Hall effect sensors in the new Alarmo alarm clock during a teardown.
- Alarmo features a 2.4-inch LCD screen, 24GHz mmWave presence sensor, and a replaceable CR2032 battery for backup.
- The inclusion of a magnet and Hall effect sensor is aimed at improving the durability and accuracy of its rotary dial.

items.title: How the EU’s DMA is changing Big Tech: all of the news and updates
items.author: Verge Staff
items.summary:
- The EU's Digital Markets Act (DMA) enforces stricter regulations on Big Tech, affecting companies like Apple and Google.
- Apple plans to introduce sideloading and alternative app stores on the iPhone to comply with EU regulations.
- Meta and Apple may soon face modest fines due to alleged violations; Google also rumored to face charges.
- The EU aims for enhanced competition by implementing interoperability measures for major tech companies.

items.title: Apple is reportedly planning a design overhaul for iOS, iPadOS, and macOS
items.author: Jay Peters
items.summary:
- Apple plans a significant redesign for iOS 19, iPadOS 19, and macOS 16 later this year.
- Changes will include updates to icons, menus, apps, windows, and system buttons to simplify user experience.
- The design takes inspiration from Vision Pro’s visionOS, marking the biggest changes since macOS Big Sur and iOS 7.
- Expected announcement at June's Worldwide Developers Conference, date not yet announced.

items.title: An iconic DJ turntable inspired this record player watch
items.author: Andrew Liszewski
items.summary:
- The AndoAndoAndo Vinyl Record Automatic Watch resembles a tiny turntable, inspired by the Technics SL-1200.
- It features a Miyota 9039 mechanical movement with a 42-hour power reserve.
- The watch face has a unique design without number labels, using dots to indicate time.
- The minute hand mimics a turntable's tone arm, and the watch includes a miniature vinyl record with two discs for timekeeping.
- Preorders are available for $438 for standard versions and $455 for a limited all-gold edition, with shipping expected in April 2025.

items.title: Sony is experimenting with AI-powered PlayStation characters
items.author: Tom Warren
items.summary:
- Sony is developing an AI-powered prototype of Aloy from *Horizon Forbidden West*.
- The demo shows Aloy interacting via voice prompts using AI for speech and facial movements.
- The technology employs OpenAI’s whisper, GPT-4, and Llama 3 for conversation.
- Sony has run demo tests on PC and PS5 with minimal overhead.
- Concerns identified about the impact of such technology on voice actors and game developers.
- Similar AI initiatives by Nvidia and Microsoft are mentioned, highlighting industry trends in AI application.
- A GDC 2024 survey indicates a significant interest in generative AI tools among game developers.

items.title: Microsoft is holding a 50th anniversary and Copilot event in April
items.author: Tom Warren
items.summary:
- Microsoft is inviting attendees to its 50th anniversary and Copilot event in Redmond, Washington on April 4, 2025.
- The event coincides with the company's founding in 1975 by Bill Gates and Paul Allen.
- It will feature an employee celebration and discussions on future developments for the Copilot AI.
- Notable speakers include CEO Satya Nadella and AI CEO Mustafa Suleyman.
- The event may showcase Microsoft’s in-house AI models aimed at competing with OpenAI.

items.title: Google's New AI Button in Gmail Automatically Adds Events to Google Calendar
items.author: Wes Davis
items.summary:
- Google introduces a new AI feature in Gmail that uses Gemini AI to add events directly to Google Calendar based on email content.
- The feature includes an 'Add to Calendar' button for emails that describe events, streamlining the process of adding those events via a sidebar confirmation.
- This change is currently being rolled out for Workspace users, business, education, and Google One AI Premium subscribers, enhancing the functionality of previous non-AI event additions.

items.title: Longer-lasting laptops: the modular hardware you can upgrade and repair yourself
items.author: Verge Staff
items.summary:
- The article discusses the growing trend of modular laptops that allow users to upgrade and repair their devices easily.
- Framework is highlighted as a leading company in this movement, producing laptops designed for longevity and upgradability.
- Other manufacturers, such as Lenovo, are beginning to adopt similar designs, driven by consumer demand for sustainable electronics.
- Past attempts by companies like Dell and Intel with modular products faced issues, paving the way for Framework's success.
- The focus is on making laptops more user-friendly regarding repairs and upgrades, contrasting with the ultrathin models that have dominated the market.

items.title: Trump’s Administration: Impact on the Tech Industry After 100 Days
items.author: Verge Staff
items.summary:
- Adam Martinez from the CFPB addressed staff confusion regarding work regulations during a court hearing.
- The GSA's DOGE chatbot is expanding usage among federal workers following a 150-person pilot, with mixed feedback.
- The DOJ continues to advocate for breaking up Google, referencing its monopolistic practices.
- Trump imposed and then paused tariffs on uranium, affecting US nuclear fuel imports from Canada.
- Trump has established a 'strategic Bitcoin reserve' to hold seized cryptocurrency assets, aiming for a digital asset stockpile.
- Tariffs on Canadian and Mexican goods initiated by Trump are largely on hold, indicating a shift in policy.
- A new State Department program using AI to monitor student activists aims to revoke visas based on social media activity related to pro-Palestine protests.

items.title: Infinity Nikki's New Interactive Map Makes It Easier to Find What You Need
items.author: Ash Parrish
items.summary:
- The developers of Infinity Nikki have introduced an interactive map to help players locate items in the game.
- The map is similar to features found in other gacha games like Genshin Impact.
- Players can find dews of inspiration and other collectibles more easily with the new system.
- The interactive map is accessible through [this site](https://pearpal.infoldgames.com/en/home) and requires logging in with Infinity Nikki account credentials for personalized features.
- It helps track missing items like treasure chests and hidden vendors in the game.

items.title: Sony will give the PS5 Pro crisper graphics — by backporting FSR 4
items.author: Sean Hollister
items.summary:
- Sony's PS5 Pro will leverage AMD's FSR 4 upscaling technology starting in 2026 to enhance game graphics.
- FSR 4 aims to improve image clarity, competing with Nvidia's DLSS.
- The collaboration between Sony and AMD, known as Project Amethyst, began in 2023, with FSR 4 being a key outcome.
- Current games on PS5 Pro are using another upscaling method known as PlayStation Spectral Super Resolution (PSSR).
- Sony intends to develop unique implementations of various algorithms with AMD beyond gaming consoles, aiming for broader applications in machine learning.

items.title: All the news about Sony’s PS5 Pro
The Tesla protests are getting bigger — and rowdier
Fortnite is set to return to Brazilian iPhones
items.author: Jay Peters
items.summary:
- Epic Games plans to bring Fortnite to iOS users in Brazil in July 2024.
- This follows a Brazilian ruling requiring Apple to allow sideloading within 90 days.
- In August 2023, Epic launched the mobile Epic Games Store on iOS in the EU after Apple was forced to comply with the Digital Markets Act.
- The Brazilian judge noted that Apple has complied with similar obligations in other countries without significant harm to its economic model, and Apple intends to appeal this ruling.
- The Epic Games Store is already available on Android and was launched on iPad in the EU in September 2024.

items.title: Why the internet still needs Section 230
items.author: Ron Wyden
items.summary:
- Section 230 of the Communications Decency Act is often blamed for internet issues, but it remains crucial today.
- Trump and other politicians challenge Section 230, claiming it allows tech companies too much control.
- The law provides a liability shield for tech platforms, essential for their existence, especially for new competitors like Bluesky.
- Section 230 allows individuals to control what they see online without intrusive government regulation.
- The law emphasizes that distributors (like websites) are not liable for user-generated content.
- In 1996, Wyden and Chris Cox crafted Section 230 amidst government censorship fears and rising internet use.
- The law was passed after a critic's failed bid to impose strict regulations on internet content.
- It provides essential protections to both content creators and distributors, enabling free expression online.

items.title: Space collisions could become a bigger risk thanks to greenhouse gas pollution
items.author: Justine Calma
items.summary:
- Greenhouse gas emissions could increase satellite collision risks by contracting Earth's upper atmosphere.
- The study published in *Nature Sustainability* explores the implications of pollution on satellite operations.
- Research estimates that satellite carrying capacity could decline by 50 to 66 percent in 75 years under high emissions scenarios.
- Current satellite numbers exceed 20,650; growing concerns over collisions as more satellites crowd lower Earth orbit.
- The findings underscore the need for space sustainability awareness among satellite operators and the public.

items.title: My Hero Academia: Vigilantes slides onto Crunchyroll in April
items.author: Charles Pulliam-Moore
items.summary:
- Crunchyroll will stream *My Hero Academia: Vigilantes* starting April 7th, with new episodes weekly.
- The series is a prequel to *My Hero Academia*, set five years earlier.
- The story revolves around Koichi Haimawari, a college student with a quirk that allows him to glide, as he helps people alongside his friends.

items.title: OnePlus’ signature Alert Slider is ‘evolving’ into a button
items.author: Wes Davis
items.summary:
- OnePlus will replace the Alert Slider with a customizable button, as announced by CEO Pete Lau.
- The change aims to provide a more personalized experience and will retain the ability to switch sound profiles without waking the phone.
- No details on which models will receive the new button or its release date have been provided.
